body:
<!--
**PLEASE READ THIS FIRST:**
- Do not use the bug and feature tracker for support requests. Use the `cython-users` mailing list instead.
- Did you search for similar issues already? Please do, it helps to save us precious time that we otherwise could not invest into development.
- Did you try the latest master branch or pre-release? It might already have what you want to report. Also see the [Changelog](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/CHANGES.rst) regarding recent changes.
-->

**Bug Trace**

```
Compiling solve_utils.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Cythonizing solve_utils.pyx

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
        print("True")
    else:
        print("False")

    v1 = 1
    if v1 in h1: pass  # h1 is a cython array of int
         ^
------------------------------------------------------------

solve_utils.pyx:30:10: Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform

ModuleNode.body = StatListNode(solve_utils.pyx:3:0)
StatListNode.stats[0] = CFuncDefNode(solve_utils.pyx:5:5,
    args = [...]/2,
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    outer_attrs = [...]/2,
    visibility = 'private')
File 'Nodes.py', line 396, in analyse_expressions: StatListNode(solve_utils.pyx:7:4,
    is_terminator = True)
File 'Nodes.py', line 6785, in analyse_expressions: IfStatNode(solve_utils.pyx:30:4)
File 'Nodes.py', line 6831, in analyse_expressions: IfClauseNode(solve_utils.pyx:30:7)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 651, in analyse_temp_boolean_expression: PrimaryCmpNode(solve_utils.pyx:30:10,
    operator = 'in',
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 12927, in coerce_to_boolean: PrimaryCmpNode(solve_utils.pyx:30:10,
    operator = 'in',
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "C:\Users\jm\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python39\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\ExprNodes.py", line 12927, in coerce_to_boolean
    if self.is_pycmp:
AttributeError: 'PrimaryCmpNode' object has no attribute 'is_pycmp'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\jm\Dropbox\Work\Python\test\setup.py", line 25, in <module>
    ext_modules = cythonize(["solve_utilsi.py", "solve_utils.pyx"],
  File "C:\Users\jm\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python39\lib\site-packages\Cython\Build\Dependencies.py", line 1116, in cythonize
    cythonize_one(*args)
  File "C:\Users\jm\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python39\lib\site-packages\Cython\Build\Dependencies.py", line 1283, in cythonize_one
    raise CompileError(None, pyx_file)
Cython.Compiler.Errors.CompileError: solve_utils.pyx

Process finished with exit code 1
```

**Expected behavior**
I expected it not to crash

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - Python version 3.9.7
 - Cython versions 0.29.24 and 3.0.0a9

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

comment_data.body: Could you clarify: do you mean `h1` is typed as `cdef cython.view.array h1`, or something else?

title: [BUG] Compiler crash in AnalyseExpressionsTransform parsing "if v1 in h1:" where h1 is a cython array.
